page.title: 19RECREATION SPORT AND HOBBIES
page.content: The Mid-Devon,dating from c.1790, hunts over this area and has many supporters - hound puppies are "walked" in the summer months. Riding is very popular and the owner of Lower Nattadon races his horses at Newton Abbott and elsewhere. Waye Barton has been established as an equestrian centre during the last two years. Farmers at Batworthy,Buda,Lingcombe and Shapley all shoot, chiefly pigeons and rabbits, also fish for trout and salmon. Golf is popular with the young and at Middlecott a retired farmer has laid out a two acre practice field. At Beetor Farm there is an 11 acre motor cycle scrambling course. Other outdoor hobbies include bee-keeping and sheep showing. At weekends hang gliding and model aeroplane flying are popular with visitors to Meldon and Nattadon.
